help.simple: The help command, use it to find out more about...stuff, I guess?

details.details: Really, it's just a help command. Why did you feel the need to type that?

schedule.simple: Allows to post and edit the schedule

details.-d [day]:
Posts the raids for the respective day on the default channel.
[day] can either be the full name of the day, a 1 or 3 letter abbreviation, or even a digit 1-7 representing the value of the day, starting with Monday.
details.-dt [day]: Posts the raids for the respective day on the default test channel.
details.-u: Updates the current posted schedule with the new one.
details.-cc [channel_name]:
Changes the default channel to post the schedule to.
[channel_name] can either be the actual name of the channel, or you can simply ping it for comfort.
details.-cct [channel_name]: Changes the default test channel to post the schedule to.
details.-ch [time]:
Changes the hour at which raids should be automatically posted.
[hour] can be given simply as a number, for example: "ai!ps -ch 20" which will be converted into a time+minute format 20:00.
Or, it can also be given as an hh:mm format, for example 19:42.

info.simple: Displays some info about the bot.

details.details: Displays info about the current version, channels to post to and the hour at which to automatically post raids.
